back: A pair consisting of a key and its associated value, as used in dictionaries.
An immutable identifier used to access a corresponding value in a dictionary.
The data associated with a key in a dictionary.
A collection of key-value pairs where each key is unique.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
A concise way to create dictionaries from iterables using a single expression.
A concise way to create sets from iterables using a single expression.
